16:24 <akats> sdumitriu: I think I fixed it, but it's a hack 16:24 <sdumitriu> How? 16:25 <shalinshah1993> has quit 16:26 <akats> I'm not certain, but the problem appears to be that the context has no document set, because I'm running the REST server. So what I did is get the current context through execution, and setDoc() to DocumentReference("xwiki", "Main", "WebHome") 16:26 <sdumitriu> Oh, you're running through rest 16:26 <sdumitriu> Yes, that's normal 16:27 <akats> Ahaha xwiki normal that is 16:27 <sdumitriu> Were the two requests on different servers? 16:28 <sdumitriu> It's not a bug, it's a feature!" 16:28 <akats> Well same server, just talking to itself 16:29 <akats> Is there a proper way of doing what I did? 16:41 <Shubham1> has quit 16:57 <Shubham> has quit 17:12 <tian2992> has joined #phenotips 17:12 <akats> When the results come back, (to the user on Phenotips who made a request) how should they be displayed? 17:12 <akats> as in, should it be just pretty text? 17:12 <akats> or should a "fake" patient be created? 17:15 <Shubham> has quit 17:21 <tian2992> has left #phenotips 17:33 <tweety098> has quit 17:35 <akats> has quit 17:37 <Shubham> has quit 17:38 <vijay13> has quit 17:45 <Shubham> has quit 17:51 <vijay13> has quit 18:06 <Shubham> has quit 20:53 <vijay13> has quit 20:58 <Shubham> has quit 21:05 <Shubham> has quit 21:16 <Shubham> has quit 22:15 <Shubham> has quit 22:21 <Shubham> has quit 23:11 <shalinshah1993> has quit
